etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 帚(帚) (zhǒu, "broomstick") = hand with a broomstick -> sweeping action
etymology.interpretation: The character 扫(掃) (sǎo, "sweep") visually combines 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") with 帚(帚) (zhǒu, "broomstick"), clearly indicating the act of sweeping with a broom.
etymology.simplification: 扫(掃): Simplified by removing 冖(冖) (mì, "cover") and 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") for a less complex form.

examples.chinese: 她扫落叶(她掃落葉)，使庭院焕然一新(使庭院煥然一新)。
examples.pinyin: tā sǎo luòyè, shǐ tíngyuàn huànrán yī xīn.
examples.english: She swept up the fallen leaves, making the courtyard look brand new.
